title: Hebrew translation: listCategory, category, and context engine display values
description: The app has data-driven display values — listCategory values, category labels, sub-hub type labels, context engine keywords — that are rendered in the UI but bypass the i18n system entirely. These must be translated to Hebrew. This is a companion to fe-008 (general string audit) and focuses specifically on enum/constant values that originate from data models or utility files.
scope: src/utils/contextMapping.ts — category keyword arrays used for context detection
src/utils/he/contextMapping.ts — Hebrew version, verify all categories covered
src/utils/suggestions.ts — suggestion labels and category names shown in UI
src/utils/he/suggestions.ts — Hebrew suggestions, audit for completeness
src/utils/contextResolver.ts — resolves context to display names, must use t() or Hebrew map
src/utils/iconMapping.ts and src/utils/he/iconMapping.ts — any display labels
src/types/sub-hub.ts — listCategory enum/type values that are rendered as UI text
src/types/base.ts — any category/type values displayed to users
All components that render .listCategory, .category, or .type fields directly in JSX without t()
approach: 1. Search for all places listCategory and category values are rendered: grep -r 'listCategory\|category' src/components src/pages --include='*.tsx'
2. Identify every unique display value (e.g. 'Grocery', 'Household', 'Personal', 'Supermarket', etc.)
3. For each value: add an i18n key under the appropriate namespace (e.g. common:categories.grocery)
4. Add Hebrew translations to src/i18n/he/ for every new key
5. Replace raw value renders with t('namespace:key') — use a mapping function if needed
6. Verify src/utils/he/ files are complete and consistent with src/utils/ English equivalents
7. Run npm run build to confirm no TypeScript errors
conventions: Category keys go under common:categories.{name} or the relevant hub namespace
Use lowercase snake_case for i18n keys
Do not translate: database IDs, brand names (BuyMe, Ontopo, Wolt), technical keys
RTL-safe rendering — do not add directional classes, use logical Tailwind only
acceptance_criteria: No listCategory or category values rendered as raw English strings when language is Hebrew
All src/utils/he/ files match the structure of their src/utils/ English counterparts
Every category/listCategory displayed in the UI has a Hebrew translation
notes: Run alongside fe-008. Both tasks can be worked in parallel by the same agent on the same branch: agent/fe-008-009-hebrew-full.
